info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rensselaer and southwestern Bennington Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bennington, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Hoosick Falls, Pownal, Grafton, Berlin, Brunswick, Hoosick, Poestenkill, North Bennington, Woodford, Old Bennington, Glastenbury, Paper Mill Village, Sodom, Petersburg Junction, Quackenkill, East Hoosick, Babcock Lake, Readsboro Falls and South Shaftsbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
